intro: Ceraia macrapora, commonly known as the broad-leafed sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like inflorescence composed of small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, showing a preference for well-drained environments. Its leaves are broad and lobed, often with a slightly hairy texture. Ceraia macrapora plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and provides habitat for various small invertebrates.
